page.title: 08Church and Chapel, Wray
page.content: There used to be four churches in Wray, but now only Holy Trinity Parish Church, built in 1840, and the Methodist Chapel, built 1848, remain in use. The Quaker Meeting House is now used by the Methodists, and the Free Church is a private house. At Holy Trinity Church, the first service each month is Holy Communion, the second and fourth Sundays are Matins, and the third Sunday is a Family Service. The vicar visits people in Wray, particularly the sick and lonely. The Methodist Chapel is important for the many families who worship there. Two services are held each Sunday, and a Sunday School which is well attended by children of all denominations. The Minister does not come every Sunday. In his place, there is a rota of lay preachers.
